title: Microsoft PowerPoint 2013 for Beginners - Create Amazing Presentations
headline: Learn how to bring your presentation skills to the next level with this free online PowerPoint for beginners course.
description: This free online Microsoft PowerPoint 2013 for beginners course will teach learners of any skill level how to create attractive and informative presentations. You will learn about its new features in comparison to previous versions and look closely into the Presenter View feature including how it has been improved in PowerPoint 2013. You will also learn how to access templates in PowerPoint 2013, use its Touch Mode, and a whole lot more!
courseDescription:
In PowerPoint 2013 you can do more than ever when it comes to creating expertly designed slideshows. In this course, your professional instructor will walk you through the exciting new features of PowerPoint 2013. Throughout this class, you’ll learn the most effective ways to create polished presentations along with valuable shortcuts and tips for saving time.

Starting with the basics, you’ll discover how to work with the colorful new PowerPoint 2013 templates and to design your own backgrounds from scratch. Then, you’ll learn about autocorrect and proofing before moving onto templates headers, footers and formatting such as bulleted lists. Don’t let technical difficulties get in your way.

Effective presentation skills are needed by most professionals no matter what area they work in. By studying this free online course you can present at any meeting with confidence by learning to create stunning presentations. From 10 minute slideshows to lengthy presentations, this PowerPoint 2013 training course will give you the tools you need to share your story effectively. So start this course today and by the end of the week you will have brought your presentation skills to the next level.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital : a downloadable in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

• On successful completion of this module, students will be able to: 

    • Demonstrate an awareness about what features are new in PowerPoint 2013 in comparison to previous versions.

    • Describe what the Presenter View feature is and how it has been improved in PowerPoint in 2013. 

    • Identify how to access presentation templates in PowerPoint 2013. 

    • Discuss the use of Touch Mode in PowerPoint 2013.

• Acquiring PowerPoint 2013

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

• What's New in PowerPoint 2013

• Using Touch - Overview of Principles

• Having studied this module, you should be able to:

    • Identify what PowerPoint 2013 is typically used for. 

    • Demonstrate a general awareness about what features are new in PowerPoint 2013 from previous versions.

    • Describe what the Presenter View feature is and how it has been improved in PowerPoint in 2013. 

    • Identify how to apply presentation templates in PowerPoint 2013.

    • Discuss the use of Touch Mode in PowerPoint 2013.

• On successful completion of this module, students will be able to:
    • Discuss the use of Backstage View options in PowerPoint 2013.
    • Describe how to protect the contents of a presentation by encrypting it with a password. 
    • Identify how online and offline help can be accessed in by using either the menu options or F1 keyboard shortcut.
    • Demonstrate an awareness about how to access customize settings and preferences. 
    • Identify how to customize settings and preferences in PowerPoint 2013.
